title.narrative: Life-saving Nutritional and reproductive health support to pregnant mothers and new born through Maternity Waiting Homes (MWHs) in remote rural area of Eritrea.

description.narrative: The main objective of this project is to reduce maternal and neonatal morbidity and mortality by increasing the rate of skilled attended deliveries in the Zobas of Northern Red Sea and Anseba. UNFPA will use CERF funds to improve the quality of care and provisions (food, nutritional and non-food items) available for women and children at 16 Maternal Waiting Homes (MWH). Through this approach UNFPA aims to increase the incentive particularly for drought-affected mothers and accompanying children to use skilled attended deliveries. An estimated 2,430 people (2,100 pregnant women and 330 accompanying children) will benefit from this project which will be implemented within 6 months.

owner-org.narrative: UN OCHA Central Emergency Response Fund (CERF)

organisation.narrative: UN Office for the Coordination of Humanitarian Affairs (OCHA)

description.narrative: Disbursement to CERF Project Life-saving Nutritional and reproductive health support to pregnant mothers and new born through Maternity Waiting Homes (MWHs) in remote rural area of Eritrea.

condition.narrative: CERF funding is based on an agreed proposal, including specific planned outcomes and outputs.
